wellcomeml.io package

Subpackages

  • wellcomeml.io.epmc package
    • Submodules
    • wellcomeml.io.epmc.client module

Submodules

wellcomeml.io.io module

Utilities for loading and saving data from various formats

wellcomeml.io.io.read_jsonl(input_file)

Create a list of dicts from a jsonl file

Parameters

input_file (str) – File to be loaded.

wellcomeml.io.io.write_jsonl(input_data, output_file)

Write a list of dicts to jsonl (line delimited json)

Output format will look like:

` {'a': 0} {'b': 1} {'c': 2} {'d': 3} `

Parameters

  • input_data (dict) – A list of dicts to be written to json.

  • output_file (str) – Filename to which the jsonl will be saved.

wellcomeml.io.s3_policy_data module

class wellcomeml.io.s3_policy_data.PolicyDocumentsDownloader(s3, bucket_name, dir_path)

Bases: object

Interact with S3 to get policy document texts

Parameters

  • bucket_name – the S3 bucket name to get data from

  • dir_path – the directory path within this s3 bucket to get policy data from

download(hash_list=None)

Download the policy document data from S3

Parameters

hash_list – a list of hashes to specifically download, if None then download all

get_all_s3_keys()

https://alexwlchan.net/2017/07/listing-s3-keys/ Get a list of all keys to look for pdfs in the S3 bucket.

get_hashes(word_list=None)

Get a list of policy document hashes from the S3 location

Parameters

word_list (list) – a list of words to look for in documents, if None then get hashes for all

Returns

a list of dicts with the file hash and the policy doc source where it is from

Return type

list

save_json(documents, file_name)

class wellcomeml.io.EPMCClient(api_endpoint='https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest', max_retries=60, log_level=20)

Bases: object

EPMC_URL = 'https://www.ebi.ac.uk/europepmc/webservices/rest'
get_citations(session, pub_id, source='MED')

Fetches citations from EPMC’s REST API for a given publication pub_id and source (e.g. ‘MED’)

get_full_text(session, pmid)

Fetches full text from EPMC’s REST API for a given pmid.

get_references(session, pub_id, source='MED')

Fetches references from EPMC’s REST API for a given publication pub_id and source (e.g. ‘MED’)

requests_session(adapter_kwargs=None)

Returns a requests session with retry params in place, and configured for a single persistent connection (since we generally expect one session per thread).

search(session, query, result_type='core', page_size=10, only_first=True, **kwargs)

Fetches metadata from EPMC’s REST API for a query.

search_by_doi(session, doi, **kwargs)
search_by_dois(session, dois, **kwargs)
Parameters

  • session – requests.Session

  • dois – list of DOI strings

Yields

Dicts of EPMC responses
